page.title: 01Head of Loch Torridon
page.content: The land around the head of Loch Torridon consists of heathers covered rugged hills. The highest point being Beinn na h Eaglaise at 737m it is estate land used for the grazing of sheep and deer. The population of the small hamlet of Annat is either retired or employed at local land work. The Loch Torridon Hotel is surrounded by woods of mainly conifers and is only open during summer tourist season. Adjacent to the Torridon Hotel is the Ben Damph public bar, which is also the local petrol station (see barman to obtain petrol) The Ben Damph is only public bar in the area and therefore is used as a meeting place for the outlying local population as well as a haven during bad weather for the many climbers who visit the area to climb the high mountains round Loch Torridons.
